Class FoodInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent

            • gui.FoodInventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class FoodInventory
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A panel of food icons to display food that is in the player's inventory.
    Author:
    Alex Tompkins (ato47)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FoodInventory

        public FoodInventory(java.util.HashMap<FoodType,java.lang.Integer> playerFoods,
                     java.awt.Font semiBoldFont)
        Create the panel of food icons for food that is in the player's inventory. The panel is 3 food icons wide and adjusts height to accommodate however many rows are necessary to display all food icons. Gets placed in a JScrollPane for easy viewing.
        Parameters:
        playerFoods - The HashMap containing the food types mapped to their quantities in the player's inventory.
        semiBoldFont - The font to use for the quantity label on the icons.

    • Method Detail

      • getFoodIcons

        public java.util.HashMap<FoodType,FoodInventoryIcon> getFoodIcons()

      • setFoodIconsEnabled

        public void setFoodIconsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets all the food icons in this inventory to either enabled or disabled. Disabling them will grey them out in order to show to the player that they cannot be used yet.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True for setting food icons to be enabled, false for setting food icons to be disabled
